Con una ambientación muy cuidada y con puzzles absorventes, es uno de los mejores juegos de Valve. No solo son puzzles, es una historia de un futuro mecanizado y oscuro, llevando el ambiente del primero a una historia mucho mas compleja y larga.¡ Y la opcion de 2 jugadores llega la diversión al cubo! Y si aún no hay suficiente, hay decenas y decenas de buenos puzzles en el workshop.

In short, this is the best puzzle game you are ever likely to play. The gameplay is not at all like the average puzzle game; it has intereting and quite funny characters, a first-person perspective, and utilizes its unique premise in every way possible. Level design is quite good, and the game's graphical fidelity is quite high. The only possible downside is its short length, though this has since been rendered irrelevant due to the (now cooperative!) Perpetual Testing Initiative by allowing you to play through community generated puzzles. Overall, this game is excellent, and definitely worth its price.

je recommande ce jeu même si vous allez peiner pour quelque salle mais ce jeu  est tous simplement génial avec une vrai histoire fondé ;) . Bref ce JEU est vraiment le BEST jeu en maniére de réflexion !

名作パズルアクションのPortalの続編です。
操作は全くそのままに新たなギミックが追加されています。
シングルのボリュームは前作の3倍くらいに増えており、満足感があります。
今作はストーリーも重視しているので長くてもあまりダレません。
GLaDOSの正体やAperture Scienceがどんなところかも色々と明らかにされますので、
必ず前作をプレイしてからやりましょう。
EDの歌は感涙の出来です。
awesome game

I wanted to re-write my review because my previous one was way too short for such a complex and brilliant game.  The characters are entertaining and three dimentional (not just in a graphic sense), the puzzles are challenging, but not condescendingly hard.  The envionment is beautifully rendered and tells a story beyond what is communicated through character interactions.  This game is so good, it actually helped me break my World of Warcraft addiction and explore other games again.  I applaud you, Valve... you have given me my curiosity back.

Portal 2 has got to be, hands down, one of the best games I've ever played. It's got everything you need in a game without smothering you with nonsense.

You play as Chell, our wonderful mute protagonist from the first Portal game. After who knows how long in extended relaxation, you're awakened by Wheatley, a personality construct in charge of the Relaxation Wing. He needs your help to escape the facility, saying you're the only human left who can help him. You embark on an adventure through the decaying remains of Aperture to help with his poorly planned escape. However, due to Wheatley's incompetence, you accidentally wake up GLaDOS, the homicidal super A.I. that hunted you down in the last game. And she's not the least bit happy to see you. Friends become enemies, enemies become reluctant allies, and you literally climb your way out of the past by solving puzzles with the amazing physics defying portal device to escape the facility and keep it from exploding.

While some may find this game short, it's actually pretty relaxed in how it functions. There is no one way to complete a puzzle. There is the way the guides tell you, and then there is a thousand other possibilities. Anything is possible in the halls of Aperture Science. No matter how insane it sounds. There really can't be a lot said for the gameplay. Enter portal, exit portal is all there really is. But the way it's expanded is brilliant. How you solve a puzzle can be an adventure in itself. Especially when you discover the Rat Dens...

The best part of this game is the story. There has always been more to Aperture Science and GLaDOS than meets the eye. Now, you get to learn her tragic history while also learning about the origins of the company itself. It's both funny and sad at the same time. You find yourself sympathizing with the insane computer that tried to kill you in the first game and in a round about way, help her find peace.

Friends ask me if I hope for a Portal 3. Honestly, I don't. Why? Because this game gave Chell the perfect ending to her story. And that's where it needs to stay. 

The voice acting...oh, how can I talk about this game without talking about the voice acting? Of course, Ellen McLain once again gives a knock-out performance as GLaDOS. This time, she's joined by British comedian Stephen Merchant voicing Wheatley, and J.K. Simmons voicing the prerecorded messages of Cave Johnson (the founder of Aperture Science). Also, legendary voice actor Dee Bradley Baker doing the voices (or sounds, rather) for Atlas and P-Body, the co-op bots.

I didn't do a good job reviewing the game before. I really only put one sentence because I wanted the Steam achievement. But coming back years later, I should have done this game more justice. This is a game you will remember for a very long time. You will find yourself revisiting this game and remembering why you loved it so much. This game means a lot to me and it will continue to do so for years to come.

Классная игра для Кооперативного прохождения и В одиночку не даст вам скучать.
Отличный редактор уровней. Доступ к мастерской стим позволяет скачивать и закачивать ваши и карты созданные другими игроками Portal 2.
Карты из мастерской можно проходить как в одиночку так есть и карды для совместного прохождения которые требуют двух или более игроков.
Если у вас есть свободное время то поиграйте в эту игру она будет отличным досугом.
